Key Match Events: David Peterson allowed five runs, four earned, on eight hits with four strikeouts in just 3 ²/₃ innings.
Adam Ottavino allowed a back-breaking homer in the Mets' loss.
Alec Bohm blasted a three-run homer that gave the Phillies an 8-2 lead.
Edmundo Sosa's sacrifice fly pulled the Phillies within 2-1.
Johan Rojas stroked a two-run double that put the Mets in a 4-2 hole.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets played a fifth straight game without Francisco Lindor, who is sidelined with lower back soreness.
Jose Iglesias, batting leadoff during Lindor’s absence, continued his sizzling play with a homer leading off in the first.
The Mets took a 2-0 lead after Starling Marte’s single and a walk to Mark Vientos.
Mendoza emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: David Peterson said he was ‘surprised’ he was removed so early by manager Carlos Mendoza.
The Mets took a 10-run loss to the Phillies, ending their winning streak at four games.
Miami beat Atlanta, allowing the Mets to maintain their two-game lead over the Braves for the NL’s third wild card.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Eddy Alvarez was enlisted to pitch the ninth and worked a scoreless inning, eliciting chants of ‘Ed-dy, Ed-dy’ from the crowd.
The Phillies clinched a postseason berth for a third straight year with Friday’s win.
A victory Saturday or Sunday would allow the Phillies to celebrate winning the NL East title before leaving Queens.
